Title.evidence: In this single-blind randomized clinical trial

Trial_Design.evidence: In this single-blind randomized clinical trial performed at 2 institutions in South Korea from March 2, 2010, to January 22, 2016

Participants.evidence: a total of 184 patients with stage III or IV ovarian cancer with residual tumor size less than 1 cm were randomized

Intervention.evidence: randomized (1:1) to a HIPEC (41.5 °C, 75 mg/m 2 of cisplatin, 90 minutes) or control group

Objective.evidence: Objective: To assess the clinical benefit of HIPEC after primary or interval maximal cytoreductive surgery in women with stage III or IV primary advanced ovarian cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was progression-free survival.

Number_Randomised.evidence: a total of 184 patients with stage III or IV ovarian cancer with residual tumor size less than 1 cm were randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 184 Korean women who underwent randomization, 92 were randomized to the HIPEC group and 92 to the control group

Result_Outcome.evidence: median progression-free survival was 18.8 months (IQR, 13.0-43.2 months) in the control group and 19.8 months (IQR, 13.7-55.4 months) in the HIPEC group ( P = .43)

Harms.evidence: Overall survival and adverse events were key secondary end points.
